text: The 2001–02 Czech First League, known as the Gambrinus liga for sponsorship reasons, was the ninth season of top-tier football in the Czech Republic. ==Stadia and locations== ==League standings== ==Top goalscorers== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- !Rank !Player !Club !Goals |- !1 |align="left"| Jiří Štajner |align="left"|Slovan Liberec |15 |- !2 |align="left"| Jan Nezmar |align="left"|Slovan Liberec |14 |- !3 |align="left"| Milan Pacanda |align="left"|Brno |13 |- !rowspan="3"|4 |align="left"| Milan Baroš |align="left"|Baník Ostrava |rowspan="3"|11 |- |align="left"| Horst Siegl |align="left"|Příbram |- |align="left"| Vítězslav Tuma |align="left"|Sparta Prague |- !7 |align="left"| Radek Divecký |align="left"|Teplice |10 |} ==See also== * 2001–02 Czech Cup * 2001–02 Czech 2. Liga ==References== * ČMFS statistics Category:Czech First League seasons Czech 1
title: 2001–02 Czech First League
